definition: to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: Only those who have read his general collection can understand his literary path.
sentences.chinese: 看過他總集的人，纔會瞭解他的文學創作之路。

sentences.english: The Book of Songs is the earliest collection of poems and songs in China.
sentences.chinese: 詩經是中國歷史上第一部詩歌總集。

sentences.english: Mozi is the collection of Moist writings of the Warring States Period.
sentences.chinese: 《墨子》是戰國時期墨家著作的總集。

sentences.english: Tom: Absolutely, The Book of Songs is one of the earliest anthologies of verse in china.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，《詩經》是最早的一部詩歌總集。

sentences.english: Wenxuan selected by Xiao Tong is the earliest existing set of poems.
sentences.chinese: 蕭統《文選》是我國現存最早的一部詩文總集。

sentences.english: The Collection of Huajian School is the first collection of literati's Ci-poetry.
sentences.chinese: 《花間集》是我國詞史上第一部文人詞總集。

sentences.english: This article deals with certain aspects of the Complete Works of Opera of the Yuan Dynasty compiled by Prof.
sentences.chinese: 《全元戲曲》是由王季思先生主編的元代戲曲總集。

sentences.english: He couldn't re-collect his mind in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 他在教室上課時思想總集中不起來。

definition: to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
to study/to learn from a master/(pupil's first person pronoun) I, your student
variant of 原來|原来[yuan2 lai2]
the distinctive style and techniques handed down from master to apprentice within a particular school
sum or volume of business transactions/turnover
